title: Holly Willoughby takes daughter Belle, 8, and son Chester, 5, on stroll
text:
She juggles presenting This Morning with being a mum-of-three.

And Holly Willoughby looked every inch the doting mum as she stepped out with her daughter Belle, eight, and son Chester, five, for a family outing.

The television host, 38, wrapped up in a burgundy beanie and faux shearling leather jacket for their morning walk.

Family: Holly Willoughby looked every inch the doting mum as she stepped out with her daughter Belle, eight, and son Chester, five, for a walk

Holly teamed the look with a matching dark red top, skinny jeans and military boots and opted to showcase her clear complexion by going make-up free.

The This Morning presenter walked hand-in-hand with Belle, who rocked pink converses and a khaki parka jacket, while Chester looked sporty in Nike trainers and Addidas coat.

The trio appeared in high spirits as they headed on their morning walk. Holly's eldest son Harry, ten, did not join them for the family outing.

Autumnal chic: The television host, 38, wrapped up in a burgundy beanie and faux shearling leather jacket for their morning walk

Fashionista: Holly teamed the look with a matching dark red top, skinny jeans and military boots

Devoted mother: The This Morning presenter walked hand-in-hand with Belle, who rocked pink converses and a khaki parka jacket

Flawless: Holly opted to showcase her clear complexion by going make-up free

The trip comes after Holly and her co-host Phillip Schofield are reportedly set to net £150,000 for working an extra half an hour each day on This Morning from January.

Following the cancellation of The Jeremy Kyle Show, ITV are revamping their schedule and This Morning's airtime is being extended by thirty minutes.

According to the Daily Mirror, insiders have revealed an extra £300,000 has been allocated to pay Holly and Phillip, 57, for their extra thirty minutes of hosting.

The presenting duo are currently paid £600,000 a year for their roles on This Morning after Holly's pay was brought in line with Phillip's in 2017.

Off the go: The trio appeared in high spirits as they headed on their morning walk. Holly's eldest son Harry, ten, did not join them for the family outing

Last year, Holly spoke about her children and how she doesn't want them to follow in her showbiz footsteps.

Thinking what careers they could delve into, the presenter told TV life magazine: 'Harry is massively into football, so I think he's going to be sporty in some way. He loved the World Cup this year and he's a big Arsenal supporter.

'Belle is bright and her imagination is amazing and she loves writing stories and disappearing into her own little world so maybe some creative.

Stylish display: Holly wore her blonde locks in a low ponytail and later took off her beanie

This Morning host Holly went on to reveal that it's too early to figure out what her youngest son Chester is interested in, as her main priority is for her children to be equipped with the necessary skills to tackle whatever life throws at them.

'By the time they go on to have careers I would hope that I've armed them with all the tools and knowledge they need and it's for them to go out and make their own mistakes and learn their own things then.'
